fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-37216].
  {panel}

Currently in Confluence when a page is delete it is placed into the local Space's Trash.   Then as an administrator I go back into the trashes and have no idea what was deleted recently and what has been there for some time.

As a workaround I have created the following process with the CLI And this would be A LOT easier if only when a page was sent to the trash it was dated on when that happened, even as simple as touch the updated time.

Create a Trash date database
For each space:
    For each item in the trash:
            Get the ID
            Does ID exist in trashDB?
            then
                  Is Date of item in TrashDB > 30 days?
                  then
                          remove ID from Trash DB and Confluence 
                 else
                          Do nothing
             else
                    Add the ID along with a current timestamp to Trash DB
fields.summary: The Trash contents remain forever in confluence and there is no way to determine age of trash
Password Recovery

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-37210].
  {panel}

h3. Summary
The header bar hides the Create button on small screens.

When using Confluence in a smaller browser window, the Create button is pushed behind other items in the header:

!https://jira.atlassian.com/secure/attachment/157669/Screen%20Shot%202015-04-14%20at%2011.43.34%20am.png|width=500!

When trying to click it, the Feedback link is given preference:

!https://jira.atlassian.com/secure/attachment/157770/Screen%20Shot%202015-04-14%20at%2011.43.44%20am.png|width=500!

I've also seen it end up on the other side of quick search:

!https://jira.atlassian.com/secure/attachment/157771/Screen%20Shot%202015-04-14%20at%2011.44.32%20am.png|width=500!

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Log in to Confluence
# Manipulate your screen resolution or browser window size to make it smaller

h3. Expected Results
The Create button should be arranged in a way that is displayed in multiple screen resolutions. 

h3. Actual Results
The screen is rendered in a way that is hidden.


h3.Workaround
Make the browser window larger or higher screen resolution
fields.summary: Header bar hides the Create button on small screens

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-37191].
  {panel}

Starting with Confluence 5.7 displaying recently updated attachements, links the file name with the new file preview, which is OK for supported previewable file types.
It does not make sense to link a non-previewable attachment with a preview functions. This should be downloaded on first click.
Therefore I suggest either
* (1) a filter only linking previewable files for preview and all others for download or
* (2) adding a (optional) filter to the macro to generate a preview link, a download link or both.
fields.summary: Recently Updated Macro renders preview link for all attachments

To whom it may concern.

When creating an article in Confluence and tabbing specific users to receive the article using the @ sign, when received via Outlook, the email has any numbered points out of sync.

This is what I did in Confluence:-
I have created in Confluence a Sales and Marketing space for us to upload all Sales and Marketing materials that sales can use to inform our customers about the Modernisation Project at Automate.
This is first Info Graphic we have created, which is a high-level introduction to Modernisation.
Talking points on this Info Graphic are:-

What is Evolve 2.0?
Evolve 2.0 is the Next Generation Evolve DMS system and will become our flagship product in the future.
What will Evolve 2.0 offer our customers:-

A new leading edge technology platform will be introducing, using the latest Progress Technologies.
The current Evolve User Interface (Screens) will be replaced over time, with a revamped modern looking User Interface (UI).

BH Automotive have listened to our customers and are making great strides to address their requests and pain points in the existing Evolve System.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-37170].
  {panel}

Firstly, apologies if this has already been raised - I hunted around but found nothing on this.

All our teams really love HipChat integration with Confluence but we are receiving more and more requests for notifications in hipchat rooms at confluence parent and child page level NOT space level. 

Our users are complaining about unnecessary 'noise' in hipchat rooms when pages are created relating to something completely irrelevant to the hipchat room just because the content lives in the same space

As a basic example, we have hc rooms dedicated to particular systems we use i.e. Jenkins, Git, Confluence and JIRA however in some instances all this information lives within one particular confluence space ie. Engineering Tools. Users of one specialist room don't have much interest in content created about a subject that is not related to the room they are in.

Space level notifications are great for wide ranging hc rooms s however the more focused the hc room should allow for a more focused integration with confluence pages. 

Any plans to allow us to select the integration between hc and confluence at a parent page or single page level?  We'd love to see this happen!
fields.summary: HipChat + Confluence integration - Allow post notifications from parent page level not just space level

  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-37156].
  {panel}

Currently the versions of a page do not reflect the included version of attachments in the page. When looking at older version of a page, attachment are always referenced as latest version. 

*Request:*

When including or linking an attachment in a page the version of the attachment should be referenced in the page. As soon as a newer version of an attachment is added, the version of the page should also reflect this. 

This enables workflows to easily work for attachment approvals. It might also help enterprise customers to move from classic document-management (e.g. Sharepoint) to a compliant web-based document-control, not only referring an approved office document within a page, but the complete confluence page as compliant document.

it is common to have a failed data point in a chart, but the chart macro does not do anything sensible when it encounters this.  For instance if you had a table like with this data:

||H1||H2||
|1|1|
|2|2|
|3|3|
|4| |
|5|5|

you'd end up with the chart macro recording the 4th charting point as a zero.  it's not a zero, it's missing.  the graph should register a blank spot not go down to zero.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-37141].
  {panel}

The {{code}} macro in confluence allows to highlight many languages and is quite useful, but often I've found that I need to describe bash shell sessions in confluence. 

The closest highlighter that Confluence has for this is _bash_, but it interprets all of the lines as shell script and can not be used to show output from a shell session in the code block.

Ideally, the shell session highlighter would only treat lines starting with {{#}}, {{$}}, {{>}} or _{{user@linuxbox}}_ (or anything that looks like a command prompt) as code and all the rest as comments or output.

There's pretty good overview of different highlighting options and their expected effects in this [Pygments shell-session lexer demo|https://bitbucket.org/christianjann/pygments-shell-session-lexer-demo] (or just see the[ comparison of different "modes" of highlighting|http://jann.cc/pygments-shell-session-lexer-demo/shell_code_comparison.html]).
fields.summary: Add support for shell session highlighting in Confluence

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-37135].
  {panel}

Quite often when troubleshooting, the Confluence logs can be inundated with errors to the point where its not possible to distinguish events. 

Additionally, repeating errors have the side effect of making the logs roll, which means we can't go back a day or so. In those cases, we typically do a "wait and see" while we keep our ear to the ground. 

Suggested log structure for Confluence Cloud to help alleviate said conditions above: 

*Confluence logging:*
/service/j2ee_confluence/log/main/confluence

*Mail logging:*
/service/j2ee_confluence/log/main/mail

_Add-On logging (would be specific to customer):_

*Team Calendars:*
/service/j2ee_confluence/log/main/teamcal

*Gliffy:*
/service/j2ee_confluence/log/main/gliffy

*Questions*
/service/j2ee_confluence/log/main/questions

Etc.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-37134].
  {panel}

I would like to be able to create a report which only shows tasks which are due by a certain date:

duedate <= dueDateTo

 It should be possible to specify dueDateTo as a specific value, or a rolling value of x days in the future/past:

tasks due this week: duedate <= +7d
tasks overdue by 3 days: duedate <= -3d

It should be possible to specify whether tasks with no due date are included or excluded:

tasks possibly due this week: duedate <= +7d include (i.e. duedate <= +7d OR duedate == null)
tasks definitely due this week: duedate <= +7d exclude
fields.summary: Task report macro - filter by due date

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-37132].
  {panel}

*Symptom*
Task Report and Task Tab in People Page give wrong URL of the pages, and "Page Not Found" is shown when clicked. It happens only when page titles contains non-alphanumeric characters (not a pretty URL).

*Steps to reproduce*
# Login to Confluence
# Create a page with a title containing non-alphanumeric characters (has some tasks inside).
# Go to "Tasks" in my page (<CONFLUENCE_URL>/plugins/inlinetasks/mytasks.action)
# Click the link on "Tasks appear on" column

*Finding*
Such links contain two question marks (please see TheProblem.jpg)

*Workaround*
Manually replace the second question mark to an ampersand. For example:
- Before: https://<SUBDOMAIN>.atlassian.net/wiki/pages/viewpage.action?pageId=4489219?focusedTaskId=1
- After: https://<SUBDOMAIN>.atlassian.net/wiki/pages/viewpage.action?pageId=4489219&focusedTaskId=1
fields.summary: Wrong URL on Task Report and Task Tab in People Page, Returns Page not Found

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-37124].
  {panel}

Hi,

Currently roadmap planner places bars roughly. The ability to define and display the start and end date for bars would help having a clear description of timing.

Including [~D Monaghan] comments, the goal of this improvement would be to :
- add an option "Start date" with a calendar. 
- add an option "End date" with a calendar. 
- add an option "Selected lane"
- once modifications are validated by the user, the bar move to it's lane and size according to specified parameters
- when the user move or change the size of the bar manually (using drag & drop) the dates are updated accordingly
- when the user change the lane of a bar manually (using drag & drop), the selected lane value is updated accordingly
- add an option to display Start and End dates on the roadmap planner ?

for markers :
- Add an option "Date" with a calendar
- Add a tick box "Today" which grays the "Date" parameter
- once modifications are validated by User, the marker is moved accordingly on the planning

Regards
Nicolas
fields.summary: [Roadmap Planner] Option to display start/end dates in bars

Images are not included in the PDF Export of Jira cases embedded in a confluence page using the Jira Issue/Filter macro.

Steps to replicate:
# Create a new Bug in Jira
# Attach an image to the Jira Bug and embed in the Description field 
# Create a new page in confluence
# Add JIRA Issue/Filter macro to the page and configure filter to includethe Jira Bug and display Description field.
# Save page
# Select Export to PDF

Expected Behaviour
* Image from the Jira Bug should be included in the PDF

Actual Behaviour 
* The image isn't included in the PDF. The rest of the description text looks as expected

We are using OnDemand Confluence (Confluence 6.7-OD-38) and Jira(6.4-OD-16)
fields.summary: Images not included in PDF Export of JIRA Issue/Filter macro

{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-37109].
  {panel}

When an unsupported file type is attached to a page, clicking on a link attempts to preview the file, with an error message "This file cannot be previewed". Prior to 5.7, these files would simply be downloaded. Now, users get an extra pop up which may be confusing. Users can still download the file from the top right corner overlay, but may not remember to do so.

There are a few points concerning this file preview:
# If the file can't be previewed (and we should have a good idea based on it's mime type and extension), why do we not just allow the file to download?
# If we can't preview the file, the message that states the file cannot be previewed should help the user to an alternate action - in this case, to download the file. Either a direct link or a guide to the download icon in the top right corner to foster the correct behavior. The current preview window relies on the user knowing the behavior of this window, which may not be 100% concrete so soon after an upgrade

Alternatively, it would be awesome if an administrator could control what file types are attempted to be previewed or not. If for example, we add the ability to preview visio files, and a company with large visio files may not want them previewed in their instance, they should have the ability to disable previews for a certain file type - and just allow the file to be downloaded.
fields.summary: The new files preview presents unsupported file types in an unfriendly fashion.

Steps to reproduce:

# Write some source code under code block macro on a Confluence page.
# Make sure you "tab" on every new line.
# Save the page
# Double click to select, the copy then text.
# Paste it on a text editor and tabs will be replaced for spaces. 
# Copy *one* of the spaces to the clipboard
# Go to http://repl.it/languages/PHP
# Type: {code} ord('[paste]'); {code}
where [paste] is Ctrl-V, pasting from the clipboard.
# The result you get is 194
# Now just type: {code} ord(' '); {code}
with a normal spacebar space.  The result you get is 32.
fields.summary: Codeblock macro converts tab to 4x ASCII 194 characters.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-37088].
  {panel}

We manage all of our permissions in Active Directory via permissions groups that follow a strict naming convention to specify space permissions.  For example:
- TOOL_Confluence_Main_Admin: This group has Admin permissions in the "Main" space.
- TOOL_Confluence_Main_Edit: This group has edit permissions in the "Main" space
- TOOL_Confluence_Main_Comment: This group has comment permissions in the "Main" space
- TOOL_Confluence_Main_View: This group has view-only permissions in the "Main" space

The idea is that all permissions are managed in Active Directory, and it is very easy to see exactly who has permissions in which Confluence spaces, and what level of permissions they have - both inside AD and inside Confluence.

We have trained all the Confluence System Administrators to set permissions up this way when a new space is created - and only system admins are allowed to create site level spaces.  The problem is, there is no reasonable way to restrict the management of permissions to ONLY Confluence System Administrators.  

We could make it so that ONLY Confluence System Administrators have "Admin" permissions in all spaces.  The problem with this option is that teams and departments then have no way of doing the other space administration tasks that we would like to allow them to do such as customizing their sidebars.

Security is the other important factor here.  It is important that only trained administrators manage permissions because untrained users may grant permissions to groups that are too broad and include external contractors that should only have limited access to spaces on an as-needed basis.

My request is as follows:
(1) Add a "Permissions" checkbox on the space permissions page - or modify the exiting "restrictions" checkbox to also apply to permissions.
(2) Make it so that if "Permissions" or "Restrictions" is unchecked then the user cannot manage permissions or restrictions - even if the "Admin" box is checked.  Currently, with the Admin box checked, a Space Administrator can manage restrictions, even if the "Restrictions" box is not checked.
fields.summary: Separate permissions management from space administration

  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-37081].
  {panel}

When a page properties macro includes an @mention or date macro, then this will be included in the page properties report.  However, if the @mention or date macro is then followed or preceded by an & symbol, the page properties report does not display these as expected.

!mention-should-display.png|thumbnail!

Instead, there is a displayed error:

{noformat}
Error: The XML content could not be parsed. There is a problem at line 1, column 869. Parser message: Unexpected character ' ' (code 32) (missing name?) at [row,col {unknown-source}]: [1,869]
{noformat}

...and 480 lines of exception logging  (see attached) that starts:

{noformat}
2015-03-30 11:29:00,482 ERROR [http-bio-8090-exec-122] [content.render.xhtml.DefaultRenderer] render Error rendering content for view: The XML content could not be parsed. There is a problem at line 1, column 868. Parser message: Unexpected character ' ' (code 32) (missing name?)
 at [row,col {unknown-source}]: [1,868]
 -- referer: http://confluence.foo.bar.com/dashboard.action | url: /display/XXX/Report+Page | userName: userx | action: viewpage | page: 19993228
com.atlassian.confluence.content.render.xhtml.XhtmlParsingException: The XML content could not be parsed. There is a problem at line 1, column 868. Parser message: Unexpected character ' ' (code 32) (missing name?)
 at [row,col {unknown-source}]: [1,868]
	at com.atlassian.confluence.content.render.xhtml.StaxUtils.convertToXhtmlException(StaxUtils.java:473)
	at com.atlassian.confluence.content.render.xhtml.storage.StorageXhtmlTransformer.transform(StorageXhtmlTransformer.java:50)
	at com.atlassian.confluence.content.render.xhtml.TransformerChain.transform(TransformerChain.java:41)
	at com.atlassian.confluence.content.render.xhtml.PluggableTransformerChain.transform(PluggableTransformerChain.java:51)
{noformat}

h4.To Replicate
# Create a page using page properties macro with label test-mention
# Within the page properties macro, have a field "user" with content that is an @mention for "userx" (or a date macro), followed by text "& team"
# Create a page using page properties report macro
# Edit the page properties report macro to use label "test-mention" and display the field "user"
# The resulting report displays column "user" with error "Error: The XML content could not be parsed."

h4.Expected behaviour
Instead of the error, expect:  "@userx & team" or date macro & team

h5.Note
Not sure if this is a problem with Confluence base rendering, with @mentions, or is specific to the macros tested.
fields.summary: Page Property Report Displays "Error: The XML content could not be parsed" for & character following an @mention or // date macro

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-37057].
  {panel}

h3. How To Reproduce
# Login as administrator on both Confluence and JIRA.
# Enable anonymous access with *Can Use* permissions via *Confluence Administration Console* > *Global Permissions*.
# Create a new *Public Space*.
# Enable anonymous access with *View* permissions on the created space via *Space tools* > *Permissions* > *Anonymous Access*.
# Create a new *Project* in JIRA.
# Create a new *Permission Schemes* and add all permissions to *Group (Anyone)*.
# Create a new *Issue Security Schemes* and add a security level with *Group (Anyone)* permission.
# Make this security level as the default security level for the new *Project*.
# Apply both *Permission Schemes* and *Issue Security Schemes* to the new *Project*.
# Create a new issue in the new *Project*.
# Copy the new *JIRA Issue* link to a Confluence page.
# Logout Confluence as anonymous user.
# Access and observe the page with JIRA link.

h3. Expected Behaviour
Anonymous should be able to view the contents within the public Confluence page.
!conf-exp.png|thumbnail!

h3. Actual Behaviour
JIRA Issue link is broken in Confluence page.
!conf-actual.png|thumbnail!

h3. Workaround
Remove the *Security Level* temporarily from the *JIRA Issue*.
fields.summary: JIRA Links Cannot Be Displayed When Issue Security Level Is Applied
Allow the PDF Export Process to Create Accessible Documents

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-37052].
  {panel}

Currently Confluence notification workbox only show you the following notifications from JIRA:
* Comments on issues that you are watching.
* Mentions.
* Shares of issues, filters and searches.
 
Since JIRA have several [notification schemas|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Creating+a+Notification+Scheme] it would be good that the Confluence workbox would also notify on those, like when a issue get assigned to your user in JIRA, for instance.
fields.summary: JIRA notifications schemes should show up on Confluence worbox
Inactive Account Manager for Confluence
Confluence should have a print button.
Optionally display the attachment count for pages listed in the Page Properties Report macro

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-37046].
  {panel}

Viewing attachments is inconsistent and quite a pain.  As I work a lot with images, I would like to very quickly see and update many images simultaneously.

There are three ways to see the attachments on a page/space, each containing different options and only one of which allows you to see the attachments.  

I've attached three images to show the options for viewing attachments:

1/ The first is the typical way of viewing all attachments on a page by clicking on the drop-down menu on the top-right corner of a page. 
2/ By adding the Attachments macro to a page. Here you CAN view the image. This is what I would like.
3/ By going to the Space Tools > Attachments. This shows almost the same as 1/ however does not allow you to edit the image on the page.

If find this very confusing.{color:red}* Why are there three different ways of listing the attachments?*{color}

The feature I really would like most is the ability to view the actual image in all three cases (as per option 2/).  The second option would be to quickly update in mass the metadata associated with the images (IE labels, names etc). 

I have contacted support and was told it could be too difficult.  However if it viewing images already possible in one of the three options noted above, why can it not be applied for all?  Why can't we choose the meta-data we want to see associated with the attachments?  Perhaps not all attachement types need to be visible - say only JPGs and other simple image types.   

Many thanks!!
fields.summary: Confluence attachments view
Disable Chart types on Confluence Macro

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-37044].
  {panel}

The gallery is a great feature for Confluence - to bring life to many pages. 
However, usually the images I want to share are spread over a tree of pages or an entire space.  As these spaces are constantly growing with new content, it is impossible to maintain the list of pages individually in the gallery settings.

Can we specify a SPACEKEY by itself (without page title)?  

Or, can we have a checkbox to indicate all pages below the specified pages in subtrees?

Thank you
fields.summary: Allow gallery to display all pages in a page tree and/or space

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-37040].
  {panel}

h3. ***Steps to reproduce***
# Go to space X
# Click Space Tools > Content Tools
# *Edit* a Blueprint Template (i.e _Troubleshooting article template_)
(!) At this point the Label button does not appear
# Make some adjustments in the template > Save
# Click on Edit for the same template after it has been saved
# Click on the *Label* button on the bottom-left side of the browser
# Add a label
# Save
# Create a New Page using the template 
# The label would not be added on the page
!Screen Shot 2015-03-26 at 10.43.15 PM.png|thumbnail!

h3. ***Summary***
The button looks is logic error, as it only appears after the template has been edited. The button should not appear when the feature is not available.
fields.summary: Label Button Does Not Work When Editing the Space Page Template.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-37016].
  {panel}

*Request Background*

Confluence super-users have the ability to see all restricted pages if they have the complete URL to the said pages. However during the space export process, super-users unable to see those restricted pages in the list of pages when choosing "Custom Export".

This may cause super-users to miss some restricted pages if they are requested to create a space export with only specific contents (unable to use the complete space export option) and include the restricted page.

*Workaround*

* Remove the restriction before creating the space export.
* Use the complete export and import it. Then remove all the unnecessary pages.
fields.summary: List Restricted Pages in "Custom Export" Option for Confluence Super-users

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-37014].
  {panel}

In order to manage the resolution of inline comments that may be spread over dozens of pages (and across multiple spaces), it would be useful to have an "Inline Comment Report" macro...  similar to the existing "Task Report" macro.

Thus, the report macro would allow filtering by:

* Space(s) and page(s)
* Labels
* Comment status (resolved, unresolved)
* Differentiate between comments on page and comments within attachments?
* etc

The "popular" tab on the Confluence Dashboard does list the number of comments... but this functionality does not provide the necessary filtering, etc.
fields.summary: Report Macro for Inline Comments

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-37012].
  {panel}

Hi,
I'm using the "Recently updated" macro for our knowledge base and I'd like an option in this macro to display the latest comment added when saving the page. Currently we can only see update time, editor and we have a "view change" option that is good for document writers, not that good for customers who just want to know quickly what has been changed.
The "Activity Stream" macro allows us to see the comments added when saving but unfortunately does not allow us to add filters per label as the "Recently Updated" macro does.

Thanks
Bruno
fields.summary: Recently updated macro: display "What did you change?" comment

  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-37005].

This bug is similar to this one, becouse colored panel macro swallow headings:
https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONF-31089
As far as I can see it's fixed, but it reappeared in our stand-alone instance in version 5.7

Note that the bug only appears with colored panel macros!

Experienced behavior illustrated with images. When:
- you create a colored panel macro, put in one or more heading formatted lines after each other and you put an empty row after them (image_1)
- you create a colored panel macro, put in one or more heading formatted lines after each other and you put an unformatted ro after them (image_2)
- you create a colored panel macro, put in one ore more heading formatted lines and put unformatted row betweem them (image_3)

Hope I explanied correctly, in case of any questions please ask.

Thanks
fields.summary: Headings misbehave in colored panel macros

Steps to reproduce:

# Create space
# Create a page with the task report macro
# Create tasks on any page
# Export space to XML or generate a full Confluence backup
# Import to new Confluence instance

h4. Expected

h4. Actual

Recreate the tasks manually.
